title: Lesson 90
paragraph: This lesson focuses on expression and voice, emphasizing articulate, eloquent, and persuasive communication.

words.meaning: having or showing the ability to speak fluently and coherently
words.japaneseMeaning: 明確に表現する、はっきり話す
words.example: She is articulate and expresses her ideas clearly.

words.meaning: fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing
words.example: His speech was eloquent and moved the audience.

words.japaneseMeaning: 表現豊かな、感情のこもった
words.example: Her expressive face revealed her emotions.

words.japaneseMeaning: 声を出す、意見を表明する
words.example: He was vocal about the need for reform.

words.meaning: willing to talk or impart information
words.japaneseMeaning: コミュニケーション能力のある
words.example: She is communicative and easy to converse with.

words.meaning: good at convincing someone to do or believe something
words.example: He gave a persuasive argument for the proposal.

words.meaning: filled with or showing great emotion
words.japaneseMeaning: 熱情的な、感情のこもった
words.example: She made an impassioned plea for justice.
He is a fervent supporter of human rights.

words.meaning: having or showing a confident and forceful personality
words.example: She was assertive in voicing her opinions.

words.meaning: showing or giving emphasis; expressing something forcibly and clearly
words.example: He made an emphatic statement about the need for action.
